sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"点燃，着火"之意。
means: kindle ： 指艰难或缓慢地把可燃料点燃，可用于比喻。
fire ： 普通用词，指将某物点燃使其燃烧起来，火势可大可小。
ignite ： 多用于科技文体，指使某物受热直到燃烧或发光，也可指用火花使易燃物迅速燃烧起来。
light ： 普通用词，指点燃易燃物，使其能发光，满足各种需要。

sentence.Network_en: The recent fighting in the area could ignite regional passions far beyond the borders.
sentence.Network_cn: 最近该地区的战斗可能激发边境以外整个地区的激动情绪。

sentence.Network_en: The rocket rises and we can see the second stage ignite.
sentence.Network_cn: 火箭升高了,我们可以看到二级点火.

sentence.Network_en: Nothing less than a fission bomb can ignite a thermonuclear reaction.
sentence.Network_cn: 威力比一个裂变炸弹小的任何东西都不能点燃热核反应.

雅思英语完整版_馆档网 ... idiot 白痴 ignite 点燃，使燃烧 ignorance 无知，愚昧.

list.abs: 汽车专业词汇总结. - 虎子的日志 - 网易博客 ... 助燃剂/增强剂 booster /enhancer 点火器 igniter 引爆剂 ignition material.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'make intensely hot'): from Latin ignire 'set on fire', from ignis 'fire'

entry.def: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes.

example.ex: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses...
example.tran: 炸弹引发的大火烧毁了大约 60 栋房屋。

example.ex: The blasts were caused by pockets of methane gas that ignited.
example.tran: 爆炸是由甲烷气囊被引燃造成的。

entry.def: If something or someone ignites your feelings, they cause you to have very strong feelings about something.

example.ex: There was one teacher who really ignited my interest in words...
example.tran: 曾经有一位老师真正激起了我对文字的兴趣。

example.ex: The recent fighting in the area could ignite regional passions far beyond the borders.
example.tran: 最近该地区的战斗可能激发边境以外整个地区的激动情绪。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to start burning; subject to fire or great heat;

sentences.sentence: "Great heat can ignite almost any dry matter"

means.word_mean: 2. start to burn or burst into flames;
3. arouse or excite feelings and passions;

sentences.sentence: "The ostentatious way of living of the rich ignites the hatred of the poor"
"The refugees' fate stirred up compassion around the world"

auth_sentence.content: Hubbard's speckled pepperings ignite a gentle fire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hubbard's speckled pepperings ignite a gentle fire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hubbard's speckled pepperings ignite a gentle fire.

auth_sentence.content: Which could ignite our sense of competition or just depress us.
auth_sentence.res_content: Which could ignite our sense of competition or just depress us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Which could ignite our sense of competition or just depress us.

auth_sentence.content: Is this going to re-ignite the Yuca mountain storage all over again?
auth_sentence.res_content: Is this going to re-ignite the Yuca mountain storage all over again?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Is this going to re-ignite the Yuca mountain storage all over again?

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表动词,"促成"; 2. 表形容词,"有……的"; 3. 表名词,"人或物"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 明确的;一定的;意志坚强的,立场坚定的
stems_affixes.word_buile: de强调+fin界线+ite有……的→adj.明确的;一定的;意志坚强的,立场坚定的
e出+rud原始+ite有……的→走出原始状态→博学

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优美的,高雅的,精致的;剧烈的,异常的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+quis寻求+ite有……的→adj.优美的,高雅的,精致的;剧烈的,异常的
favor好感,宠爱+ite有……的→adj.喜爱的,宠爱的
favorite[adj.喜爱的,宠爱的]→adj.喜爱的,宠爱的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有礼貌的,客气的;有教养的,文雅的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pol擦亮,文雅+ite有……的→adj.有礼貌的,客气的;有教养的,文雅的
bedlam混乱,骚乱+ite人或物→n.疯子,狂人

stems_affixes.value_cn: [集合名词]精华;精锐;中坚分子;精英

stems_affixes.word_buile: favor喜爱+ite人或物→n.[favourite]最喜欢的人或物 adj.喜爱的
favorite[n.[favourite]最喜欢的人或物 adj.喜爱的]→n.特别喜欢的人[或物]
gran颗粒+ite人或物→n.花岗岩,花岗石
social社会的+ite人或物→n.社会名流,名士
term+ite人或物→来自拉丁文termes白蚁
ex出+ped脚+ite促成→把脚跨出去→加快

means.word_mean: 点燃; 引发;（使）燃烧;着火

sentences.en: The blast was caused by pockets of methane gas that ignited.
sentences.cn: 爆炸是由数袋甲烷气体着火引起的。

sentences.en: The rock and roll ignites the excitement of the audience.
sentences.cn: 摇滚乐激起了观众的热情。

jushi.english: The blast was caused by pockets of methane gas that ignited.
jushi.chinese: 爆炸是由数袋甲烷气体着火引起的。
